greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of (1 - theta_4(q)*theta_4(q^3))/2 in powers of q.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
formula: Expansion of (1-(eta(q)*eta(q^3))^2/(eta(q^2)*eta(q^6)))/2 in powers of q.
a(n) is multiplicative and a(2^e) = -3(1+(-1)^e)/2 if e>0, a(3^e)=1, a(p^e) = 1+e if p == 1 (mod 6), a(p^e) = (1+(-1)^e)/2 if p == 5 (mod 6).
mathematica: Drop[CoefficientList[Series[(1 -EllipticTheta[4, 0, q]*EllipticTheta[4, 0, q^3])/2, {q, 0, 110}], q], 1] (* _G. C. Greubel_, May 09 2019 *)
program: (Scheme) (define (A115979 n) (- (* (expt -1 n) (A096936 n)))) ;; Follow A096936 for the rest of code. - _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 20 2017
def E(x): return 1 + 2*sum((-1)^k*x^(k^2) for k in (1..50))
a=((1 - E(x)*E(x^3))/2).series(x, 110).coefficients(x, sparse=False); a[1:] # _G. C. Greubel_, May 09 2019
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Feb 09 2006
